alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 3:36PM EST until January 17 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY MIX SLOWLY EXITS TONIGHT... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow and sleet accumulations up to two inches for a storm total of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Southern Somerset, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin, and Southern Franklin Counties. * WHEN...Until 4 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected with air temperatures remaining below freezing. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The bulk of wintry precipitation will taper off this evening, with some light freezing drizzle continuing after midnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Southern Somerset
